page.title: 17FARMING
page.content: The Cochrane family have farmed in Donemana for ninety years.They originally came from Scotland. One hundred and seventy acres are farmed. Just one man is employed on this on this farm.They keep no milking dairy cattle.The breeds of cattle reared are Charolais and Simmental.Sheep are reared on this farm,the breeds are Crossbreed.The rams are Blackface, Border and Leicester.Eighty head of beef cattle are reared.Thirty acres are devoted to arable farming.The crops grown are barley.potatoes and grass. The major changes in farming over the past thirty years are more intensive farming methods and mechanisation Farming in the future will become more intensive and highly mechanised.
